hackathon-description-text: Hawkathon 2016 (named for our mascot, the River Hawk) was a huge success, with almost 100 participants from all over the state hacking through the night to bring their ideas to life. This year, we are partnering with the Massachusetts eHealth Initiative and MIT Hacking Medicine to bring an even awesomer 24-hour Digital Health hackathon to UMass Lowell. We want this event to cultivate the innovative culture in and around Lowell, as well as spark new minds toward digital health entrepreneurship.
hackathon-requirements: Anything that will benefit the digital health industry!
hackathon-rules:
In general: Don't be rude!
Our hackathon is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of the following.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of robots, machines, or other hardware to change the woooorrrllldd!
The best usage of software, API's, or other computer tools for the digital health industry.
The innovation with the most effective usage healthcare data provided by John Snow Labs.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=61 Wilder St, Lowell, MA 01854, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Will be discussed during the event!

hackathon-description-header: Create the next wave of digital health innovations!
